parts.name: Toyota Super Long Life Coolant (Pink)
parts.description: The 'Pink Stuff'. Do NOT mix this with standard green coolant or even the older Toyota Red. It is a pre-mixed phosphated OAT coolant designed for aluminum engines.

parts.name: Pentosin CHF 11S
parts.description: The 'Green Gold'. BMW power steering systems use this hydraulic fluid. Putting standard red ATF in a BMW power steering reservoir will destroy the pump and rack seals.

parts.name: Motorcraft XT-M5-QS
parts.description: The 'Unicorn Juice'. Ironically, the best transmission fluid for a Mazda Miata is made by Ford. It is legendary for curing cold-shift stiffness and notchiness in Aisin manual transmissions.

parts.name: VW G12 / G13 Coolant
parts.description: The 'Forbidden Jello'. VW coolant (Pink/Violet) reacts with standard green coolant to form a thick brown sludge that clogs heater cores and radiators. Never mix them.
specs: Must be mixed with distilled water (unless pre-mixed)

parts.name: Mopar ATF+4
parts.description: Chrysler transmissions are notoriously picky. Using Dexron or Mercon in a Dodge/Jeep transmission causes shudder and failure. ATF+4 is a full synthetic fluid designed specifically for their clutch materials.

parts.name: Nissan CVT Fluid (NS-2 / NS-3)
parts.description: The 'CVT Killer'. Nissan CVTs are fragile. Using generic 'Universal CVT Fluid' is a death sentence. You MUST use the specific Green NS-2 (older) or Blue NS-3 (newer) fluid and change it every 30k miles.

parts.name: GM Dex-Cool
parts.description: The 'Orange Stuff'. Designed for long life (5 years/150k miles). However, if air enters the system (bad cap/leak), it turns into a rusty sludge. Many owners flush it and switch to Global Yellow/Green.
specs: Known for intake manifold gasket issues in 3.1/3.4/3.8L engines
